info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 21 at 4:31PM CDT until April 21 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN HIDALGO AND WESTERN CAMERON COUNTIES... At 430 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located near Sebastian and south of La Feria, moving southeast at 15 mph. Public has reported quarter sized hail near La Feria. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Harlingen, Mercedes, La Feria, Santa Rosa, La Villa, Palm Valley, Los Indios, Rangerville, Santa Maria and La Paloma. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
